grith.jgrith.certificate
Class CertificateHelper

java.lang.Object
  grith.jgrith.certificate.CertificateHelper

public class CertificateHelper
extends Object

Some very low-level helper methods. Just to illustrate how it works.

Author:
Markus Binsteiner

Constructor Detail

CertificateHelper

public CertificateHelper()
Method Detail

getCertificatesDir

public static File getCertificatesDir()
Tries to establish where the certificates directory is located.

Returns:
the first found certificates directory or getGlobusDir()/certificates if not found.

getDecryptedUsersPrivateKey

public static org.globus.gsi.OpenSSLKey getDecryptedUsersPrivateKey(byte[] password)
                                                             throws InvalidKeyException,
                                                                    GeneralSecurityException
Returns the users key, decrypted with the password provided.

Parameters:
password - the password
Returns:
the decrypted key
Throws:
InvalidKeyException - if the password was wrong
GeneralSecurityException - if something is not right with the key

getGlobusDir

public static File getGlobusDir()
Tries to establish where the globus directory is located.

Returns:
the default globus directory or $HOME/.globus if it can't be determined.

getUserCert

public static File getUserCert()
Returns the default user certificate using the cog kit. Beware, this does not check whether the certificate exists.

Returns:
the user's certificate

getUserKey

public static File getUserKey()
Returns the default user key using the cog kit. Beware, this does not check whether the key exists.

Returns:
the user's key

getUsersPrivateKey

public static org.globus.gsi.OpenSSLKey getUsersPrivateKey()
                                                    throws GeneralSecurityException
Returns the user certificate from the default location (using the cog defaults).

Returns:
the private key of the user.
Throws:
GeneralSecurityException

getX509UserCertificate

public static X509Certificate getX509UserCertificate()
                                              throws GeneralSecurityException
Returns the user certificate from the default location (using the cog defaults).

Returns:
the certificate in as X509Certificate or null if there were problems with I/O (file permissions, file not found, ...)
Throws:
GeneralSecurityException - if there is a problem with the certificate

globusCredentialsReady

public static boolean globusCredentialsReady()
Checks whether all the required globus credentials (e.g. to create a proxy) exist.

Returns:
true - if they do, false - if they do not

readCertificate

public static X509Certificate readCertificate(String pemCert)
                                       throws GeneralSecurityException
Reads a pem string and converts it to a X509Certificate object.

Parameters:
pemCert - the pem string
Returns:
the X509Certivicate
Throws:
GeneralSecurityException - the the pem string can't be parsed/read
